section.title: Presentation of the XYagle Interface
section.p: XYagle contains five pull down menus:
These menus grant accesss to the XYagle functionality.
Each menu can be tear of from the main XYagle window in order to allow the user to accesss it directly.

section.title: The File Menu
section.p: The File menu provides accesss to the "Open" and "Quit" functionalities of the XYagle interface. The functionalities of the File menu are detailed in the following sections.

section.title: Open...
section.p: By selecting the Open... item of the File menu you will be presented with the XYagle File Select dialog. Choose which schematic to load by selecting it in this dialog.

section.title: Disassemble...
section.p: The circuit disassembling can be launched from within XYagle. You will need to read the Yagle User Guide before using this option.
More information about performing the disassembling can be found in the Disassembling with XYagle Chapter of the current documentation.

section.title: Quit
section.p: Selecting this item in the File menu will exit XYagle.

section.title: The Edit Menu
section.p: The Edit menu provides accesss to the most current functionnalities of XYagle.
Most of these options will be detailled in following chapters. A quick presentation are given in the following sections:

section.title: Extract
section.p: Select the Extract option in order to switch the extract sub-netlist mode on. More information on modes can be found in the Schematic Browsing with XYagle chapter

section.title: Highlight
section.p: Select the Highlight option in order to switch the hiliting gate dependences mode on. More information on modes can be found in the Schematic Browsing with XYagle chapter

section.title: Go thru hierarchy
section.p: Select the Go thru hierarchy option in order to switch the traversing hierarchy mode on. More information on modes can be found in the Schematic Browsing with XYagle chapter

section.title: Set Depth...
section.p: By selecting the Set Depth... item of the Edit menu you will be presented with the XYagle: Prompt dialog.
Set the depth value before using the Extract or Highlight modes.

section.title: Back
section.p: By selecting the Back item of the Edit menu, you will return to the previous display configuration.

section.title: Full Figure
section.p: By selecting the Full Figure item of the Edit menu, you will return to the main figure. This option is used to return to the figure after using options that display sub-netlist of the full figure.

section.title: Find...
section.p: By selecting the Find... item of the Edit menu you will be presented with the XYagle: Prompt dialog.
This option allows you to search object by name in the current schematic.

section.title: The View Menu
section.p: The View menu provides accesss to a number of options affecting the display of the selected schematic.
The items of this menu have explicit names:

row.def: Allows the user to refresh the display.
Allows the user to display all the schematic in the XYagle main window at the more effective scale.
Allows the user to zoom in and to take a closer look to the schematic elements.
Allows the user to zoom out and to see the surrounding elements of the schematics.
Allows the user to set the zoom factor. the value is a percentage between 5 and 95%.

section.p: Applications of these options will be used in the following chapters.

section.title: The Windows Menu
section.p: The Windows menu provides access to more specific XYagle functionalities.

These options grant access to information about the schematic and the elements of a disassembled netlist. This section provide an overview of these options. complete information can be found in the XYagle Basics and Disassembled Netlist Information chapters.

row.def: Allows the user to see the structure of the next selected gate.
Allows the user to see the behavior of the next selected gate.
Allows the user to view XYagle messages.
Allows the user to display general information about the schematic such as the figure name.

section.title: the Options Menu
section.p: The Options menu provides accesss to some basic configuration of the visibility of elements displayed in the XYagle interface.
By selecting the Layer item of the Options menu, you will then be presented with the Layer dialog:
The Layer dialog allows the user to configure the visibility of the schematic.

section.title: Loading the Schematic
section.p: The XYagle graphical interface allows the user to displays different type of circuit, from transistor level schematic to hierarchical gate netlist.
To load a schematic use the Open item in the File menu.

section.title: transistor Level Schematic
section.p: XYagle displays transistor Level Schematic as a network of symbols representing transistors.

section.title: Gate Netlist
section.p: XYagle displays gate netlist as network of logical gates.

section.title: Hierarchical Gate Netlist
section.p: XYagle displays hierarchical gate netlist as a network of gates and blocs.

section.title: XYagle Basics
section.p: This section explains how to obtain information about the figure loaded in XYagle and how to use the schematic in good conditions of visibility.

section.title: Viewing General Information
section.p: To view the general information use the Show Info item in the Windows menu.
This opens a window that display the name of the loaded figure and the dimensions of the schematic.

section.title: Configuring Visibility
section.p: To configure the visibility use the Layer item in the Options menu.
XYagle display objects on layers, select on the left column the layers you want to be visible, and select on the right column the layers you want to be invisible. Then valid your choice with Apply.

section.title: Navigation in XYagle
section.p: To navigate in XYagle, use the View menu.
Use he Zoom In item of this menu to have a good visibility of the schematic.
Use he Zoom Out item of this menu to have a larger visibility of the schematic or to Fit Window display the full schematic on the display.

section.title: Schematic Browsing with XYagle
XYagle Browsing Modes
section.p: To unselect a XYagle browsing mode use the Select item in the Edit menu.

section.title: Extracting Sub-Netlists
section.p: To extract sub-netlists use the Extract item in the Edit menu.

section.title: Highlighting Gate Dependences
section.p: To highlight gate dependences use the Highlight item in the Edit menu.

section.section:
Traversing Hierarchy
To traverse hierarchy use the Go thru hierarchy item in the Edit menu.
traversing hierarchy allows the user to display the bloc sub-netlist. for example going thru the hierarchy of the muxout bloc from the previously loaded hierarchical gate netlist display the gates of the bloc.

section.title: Searching Object by Name
section.p: To search object by name use the Find... item in the Edit menu.

section.title: Viewing the Gate Structure
section.p: To view the gate structure use the Show Structure in the Windows menu
The information provided by Show Structure on a selected gate structure contains the name of the gate, the inputs and output signals.

section.title: Viewing the Gate Behavior
section.p: To view the gate behavior use the Show Behavior in the Windows menu
Show Behavior provides the logical dependence between input and output signals of the selected gate.
